comments:
The simple project creation fails if the users specify long names for the 
project name. There is no error message or limit for the number of charcaters 
allowed for the project name field as the user types long project names.

I have tried this on Eclipse 2.1.3 and Eclipse 3.0 and saw the same behaviour.

Specifying a project name of around 256 charcaters, puts up a creation problems
error dialog, with message "could not create folder". Here is the stack trace 
in the .log file:

======================================================================

Perhaps we can add name-segment-length to the validation method in
Workspace#validateName. Note that this would be OS dependant.

Note that it is not just the project name that is the problem here - it is the
project name when appended to the  metadata location for the resources plugin
and to our internal metadata file name.

If we happen to change the property store file format in this release, we should
consider no longer including the project name in the metadata location path.

Rafael, is the project name still part of the path with the new format or is it
hashed?

Note that we will always have a path restriction but if the project name isn't
part of it, that's one step forward.

In the new format, we store things under the project metadata area, which uses
the project name, so the problem still remains. I missed seeing this PR before...

We could only fix this by changing the entire project metadata location
structure. This would be a significant change requiring migration of workspace
file formats. This isn't worth the effort considering the rarity of the case. 
Also, the maximum filename length is platform and even operating system
dependent, making it difficult for us to predict when this might happen and give
a better error message.
